smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function newInstance has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message:
Parentheses around the lambda ({ o ->
                    window.setWindowAnimations(R.style.Animation_Recreate)
                    recreate()
                }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ event -> refreshNoticeMenuItem(event.isNewPm, event.isNewNotice) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ RateResult.fromHtml(it) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ pmsWrapper -> pmsWrapper.setMsgToUsername(user, toUsername) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses around the lambda ({ event ->
                    mReplyView.text.replace(mReplyView.selectionStart,
                            mReplyView.selectionEnd, event.emoticonEntity)
                }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses around the lambda ({ event ->
                    mReplyView.text.replace(mReplyView.selectionStart,
                            mReplyView.selectionEnd, "[img]${event.url}[/img]")
                }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses around the lambda ({ event ->
                    // reload when favorite remove
                    ApiFlatTransformer.flatMappedWithAuthenticityToken(s1Service, mUserValidator, mUser,
                            { token -> s1Service.removeThreadFavorite(token, event.favId) })
                            .compose(RxJavaUtil.iOSingleTransformer())
                            .to(AndroidRxDispose.withSingle(this, FragmentEvent.DESTROY_VIEW))
                            .subscribe({ wrapper ->
                                showShortSnackbar(wrapper.result.message)
                                loadViewPager()
                            }, { this.onError(it) })
                }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ PostEditor.fromHtml(it) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (votes * 100.0f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: votes * 100.0f

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of BaseAdapterDelegate.
